automation.label: Automation
automation.definition: The replacement of human labor by machines or algorithms in production processes

quotes.text: Automation represents the most significant labor market disruption since industrialization

wage_inequality.label: Wage Inequality
wage_inequality.definition: The dispersion of wages across workers, typically measured by the 90/10 ratio or Gini coefficient

task_displacement.label: Task Displacement
task_displacement.definition: The reduction in labor's share of value added due to automation of tasks previously performed by workers

shift_share_design.label: Shift-Share Design
shift_share_design.definition: An identification strategy that combines predetermined exposure shares with aggregate shocks to construct an instrument

smith_2023.title: Automation and the Labor Market
smith_2023.main_claim: Automation increases wage inequality through task displacement
smith_2023.method: Panel data with two-way fixed effects

jones_2024.title: Task Displacement and Economic Consequences
jones_2024.main_claim: Task displacement is the primary channel through which automation affects wages
